clinical_study.brief_title: A Randomized Pilot/Pharmacodynamic/Genomic Study of Neoadjuvant Paricalcitol to Target the Microenvironment in Resectable Pancreatic Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Pilot/Pharmacodynamic/Genomic Study of Neoadjuvant Paricalcitol to Target the Microenvironment in Resectable Pancreatic Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

clinical_study.source: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a randomized pilot/pharmacodynamic/genomic study of neoadjuvant paricalcitol to target the microenvironment in resectable pancreatic cancer to determine the effect of targeting the vitamin D metabolic program in the tumors of patients treated with one cycle of gemcitabine/abraxane with or without paricalcitol prior to surgery for resectable pancreatic cancer through an assessment of cellular and imaging markers.

clinical_study.condition: Patients Must Have Previously Untreated Apparently Resectable Adenocarcinoma

intervention.description: Dose: 25 micrograms Route: IV Regimen: 3x weekly, approximately 28 days before surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients must have previously untreated apparently resectable adenocarcinoma of the pancreas at registration.
- Patients must be age 18 years or older
- Standard laboratory criteria for hematologic, biochemical, and urinary indices.
- Patients must have an ECOG performance status of 0-2.
- Patients must be able to sign a written informed consent document
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are currently pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breast-feeding.
- Patients who, in the opinion of the physician, would not be clinically appropriate for receipt of the therapy regimen associated with participation
